item.title: Managing multiple versions of Python using pyenv
item.description: I recently discovered pyenv. I think it’s cool. It lets me setting up Python version easily on my Linux box. It is not written in Python and it is not installable using pip. Executing pip install pyenv in terminal didn’t work for me. I used the system package manager to install it: sudo zypper install pyenv (on OpenSUSE). Here is $ tldr pyenv for it. pyenv Switch between multiple versions of Python easily.
